intro: Eupatorium ambiguum, commonly known as boneset, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and thrives in moist, wooded areas. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant contains several bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional and modern herbal medicine.
